name: Powdery Mildew
symptoms: White powdery spots on leaves and stems.
treatment: Use neem oil or a fungicide.
precaution: Ensure proper air circulation and avoid overhead watering.

name: Root Rot
treatment: Remove affected roots and repot with fresh soil.
precaution: Avoid overwatering and ensure proper drainage.

name: Leaf Spot
symptoms: Dark, water-soaked spots on leaves that may enlarge and turn yellow.
treatment: Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil; keep humidity high.
precaution: Water at the base and avoid wetting leaves.

name: Aphids
symptoms: Sticky leaves, curled foliage, tiny green/black bugs.
treatment: Spray with insecticidal soap or neem oil.
precaution: Inspect plants regularly and isolate new plants.

name: Spider Mites
symptoms: Yellow speckles, fine webs on leaves.
treatment: Spray with water, use neem oil or insecticidal soap.

name: Mealybugs
symptoms: White cottony spots on leaves and stems.
treatment: Wipe with alcohol-soaked cotton or spray neem oil.
precaution: Isolate affected plants and keep environment clean.

name: Scale Insects
symptoms: Brown/black shell-like bumps on stems and leaves.
treatment: Scrape off gently, apply horticultural oil.
precaution: Regularly inspect stems and undersides of leaves.

name: Botrytis (Gray Mold)
symptoms: Gray fuzzy mold on flowers, leaves, and stems.
treatment: Remove infected parts, use a fungicide.
precaution: Avoid overcrowding and ensure good airflow.

name: Bacterial Wilt
symptoms: Sudden wilting, yellowing leaves, and stem collapse.
precaution: Use disease-free soil and practice crop rotation.

name: Fungal Leaf Blight
symptoms: Dark spots that merge and kill leaf areas.
precaution: Keep foliage dry and provide spacing.

name: Rust
treatment: Remove affected leaves and apply fungicide.
precaution: Avoid wetting leaves and maintain airflow.

name: Anthracnose
symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on leaves or stems.
treatment: Use copper-based fungicides and remove debris.
precaution: Prune properly and avoid overhead watering.

name: Leaf Curl
symptoms: Distorted, curled leaves with red or yellow color.
treatment: Apply fungicide early in the season.
precaution: Use resistant varieties and remove infected leaves.

name: Downy Mildew
symptoms: Yellow or pale green patches on upper leaf surfaces.
treatment: Apply fungicides and improve air circulation.
precaution: Water in the morning to allow drying time.

name: Fusarium Wilt
symptoms: Yellowing and wilting of leaves starting at the base.
treatment: Destroy infected plants and use soil solarization.
precaution: Use disease-free seeds and resistant plants.

name: Whiteflies
symptoms: Tiny white insects under leaves, yellowing foliage.
treatment: Spray with neem oil or use sticky traps.
precaution: Use reflective mulch and monitor regularly.

name: Botrytis (Gray Mold)
symptoms: Gray, fuzzy mold on leaves, flowers, or fruits; browning and decay in humid environments.
treatment: Remove and discard infected parts. Increase air circulation. Apply fungicides if needed.
precaution: Avoid overhead watering, provide proper spacing between plants, and prune regularly to increase airflow.

name: Damping off
symptoms: Leaves become puckered and curled; may turn red or yellow and fall off prematurely.
treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides early in the season. Remove and destroy affected leaves.
precaution: Use disease-resistant plant varieties, avoid watering foliage, and apply fungicides preventively in spring.
